name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I announced a plan to make the largest investment in K-12 in our state’s history to set our children up for success beyond the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/KkuF3dlb94

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Over the past year, our frontline workers have truly gone above and beyond. Tonight, we honor the correctional officers and staff that have lost their lives to COVID-19. Join One Voice United for the National Medal of Honor Virtual Vigil.  https://t.co/STCXROuqUI

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Michigan has been a national leader in the fight to end COVID-19. The work @LtGovGilchrist has done with our Racial Disparities Task Force showcases what we can achieve when we come together. Thank you @ResearchAmerica for honoring this critical work, I look forward to tuning in!

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I’m excited to announce that 55% of Michiganders have gotten their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. This is a huge milestone in getting #MIVaccToNormal and means that on May 24 we can return to in-person work. If you haven’t yet, please schedule a vaccine appointment today.  https://t.co/Q827k3Rhii

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: COVID-19 doesn’t care about state lines or political parties. That’s why I joined @GovMikeDeWine, @GovHolcomb, @GovPritzker, @GovEvers, @GovAndyBeshear, and @GovTimWalz to encourage folks to get vaccinated so we can get back to normal. This is a team effort, let’s get it done.  https://t.co/WlzqfiWpwy

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This morning, I announced that Miguel Cabrera will be co-chairing the Protect Michigan Commission. I am incredibly grateful that Miggy is stepping up to the plate to help inform Michiganders on the importance of getting their COVID-19 vaccinations.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, Michigan will surpass six million doses administered of the safe, effective COVID-19 vaccines. This is incredible news, and we will not stop until we reach our goal of equitably vaccinating 70% of Michiganders ages 16 and up.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am excited to join millions of Michiganders in the fight against COVID-19 by getting the first dose of the safe, effective vaccine. All Michiganders are now eligible, and I urge all everyone to get vaccinated to protect you and your loved ones. Let’s beat this virus together.  https://t.co/GLnTF8MAsc

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Our food and agriculture workers have been a critical part of Michigan’s fight against COVID-19. When you are eligible, please go get your vaccine.  For more information visit:  https://t.co/sV1J9lbUfR

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The West Michigan Vaccine Clinic at DeVos Place administered 13,000 vaccines today. This is a major milestone in our fight against COVID-19 and I’m incredibly grateful for the hard work of all involved. We will beat this virus, together. Let’s get it done.  https://t.co/r3K2ac5QNX

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I was honored to speak with Mary Barra, CEO of GM. Mary is bringing GM into the next generation with commitments to build 30 new Electric Vehicles by 2025. She’s led GM through a global pandemic and was a critical component of our COVID-19 response:    https://t.co/g7FsxbQEb1

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I recently had the chance to speak with Marion Whicker - Chief of Supply, Production, and Distribution for the Federal COVID-19 Vaccine Operation - about her important work and her advice for young women:  https://t.co/5kBmtzDENk

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We have taken necessary action to hold polluters accountable, established and enforced standards to protect our water from PFAs and other dangerous toxins, and ensured that families have access to water during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, the State of Michigan hit a big milestone in eradicating #COVID19. We have now officially administered 3 million shots of the safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines. We’re going to beat this thing together.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Additionally, beginning Monday, April 5, all Michiganders age 16+ who were not previously eligible will be eligible to receive a vaccine.  This is exciting news, and I urge all eligible Michiganders to get one of the three safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I ordered our flags to half-staff to honor and mourn the 500,000 American lives lost to COVID-19. As we grieve, we will continue to fight to eradicate #COVID19 entirely.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Thrilled that @DrKhaldun has been appointed to serve on White House COVID-19 Health Equity Task Force. Our entire country will benefit from her determination and expertise. Congratulations!

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Last year, I announced the Rebuilding Michigan bonding plan to fix the damn roads without an increase at the pump.   Even while combating COVID, we moved a lot of dirt. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: @LtGovGilchrist chaired the Michigan COVID Task Force on Racial Disparities, focusing on education, testing and outreach that further saved lives.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: @DrKhaldun saw the disparate impact COVID was having on communities of color and we immediately took action. This not only saved lives in Michigan, but around the country as other states learned from us. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We’ve lost over 14,000 Michiganders to COVID-19. 14,000 people with stories. With loved ones – parents and siblings, children and friends.   I think about them every day. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I appointed Elizabeth Hertel as Director of @MichiganHHS. I am grateful to Director Gordon for his service, and excited to move forward with Director Hertel’s expertise and experience at the helm as we continue to work together to end the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/yWkRPr5qt9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I was joined by @LtGovGilchrist and governors and lieutenant governors from Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Minnesota, Ohio, and Wisconsin to encourage everyone to make a plan for how you’ll get the COVID-19 vaccine once eligible.  https://t.co/VSaxseNcJj

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The Trump Administration has not only botched the rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine, but also misled the American people. After finally agreeing to release what remained of the federal vaccine reserve, we found out the truth — there isn’t one.  https://t.co/2nRyV5wYlK

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: While this will provide families and businesses the support they need to stay afloat as we continue working to distribute the safe and effective vaccine and eliminate COVID-19, there is still more work to do.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The relief bill includes $55 million to help small businesses impacted by COVID-19. Grants of up to $20,000 will be made available to small businesses across the state that need support this winter.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This morning, history was made in Michigan. Millions of doses of Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine are now on their way to distribution centers across the country. I couldn’t be more proud of the extraordinary state we call home.  https://t.co/QBGdhBDsfz

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Read some the research and data connecting COVID-19 and indoor dining below.  CDC:  https://t.co/pNzRr9yIBI Researchers from Northwestern and Stanford:  https://t.co/LqQXpMMMa4 Jeonbuk National University Medical School:  https://t.co/bachdMFlK7

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The science is settled — the best way to slow the spread is to double down on wearing masks, social distancing, and limiting indoor gatherings where people are most at risk to contract COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Threats against our elected officials, no matter their party, are dangerous and unacceptable. This must stop. Now is the time to come together against our common enemy: COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am proud of the work the MI COVID-19 Racial Disparities Task Force to protect communities of color. But as COVID-19 cases continue to rise we must continue to work together to protect our families, front line heroes, and small business. #MaskUpMichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has shown us the deep inequalities and disparities communities of color face every day. Today, @LtGovGilchrist and I announced the significant progress Michigan has made to slow the spread of the virus in these communities.  https://t.co/D5rnLIJQMo

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: With Thanksgiving around the corner, and as COVID-19 cases continue to rise, I wanted to take a moment to urge Michiganders everywhere to do your part to protect our families, our frontline workers, and our small businesses.  https://t.co/gMoD2At1Bo

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: For the 7th time in last 30 days, our top epidemiologists and public health experts hosted a covid data briefing & answered questions from legislators who made the time/chose to participate.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: THREAD: Today, I had calls on Michigan’s COVID hotspots & talked to other governors to coordinate our COVID-19 response.  https://t.co/bPdUFdnd9V

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I joined @GovAndyBeshear, @GovMikeDeWine, @GovEvers, @GovHolcomb, @GovPritzker, and @GovTimWalz to talk about protecting our families and frontliners from COVID-19 during the holidays. Mask up, we’re going to get through this together.  https://t.co/G1sZQGBOYp

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Governor Whitmer’s Statement on Pfizer Vaccine News and President-Elect Biden’s COVID-19 Response Team Announcement:  https://t.co/zqVa7vIA14

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: “Fall and winter holidays will look different this year. But there is no need for despair. We are strong, we are smart, and we care about each other. Make the choice this fall to stop the spread of COVID-19. The life you save may be your own.” - @DrKhaldun  https://t.co/U9lk6frnv8

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We are seeing an alarming rise in COVID-19 cases in Michigan right now. It is vital that we wear masks, avoid large gatherings, and practice physical distancing. Your fellow Michiganders and our frontline health care workers are counting on each one of us to do the right thing.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This is why we took action. It worked. It’s also why we need you to do everything you can to slow the spread of COVID-19.  Practice social distancing. Wash your hands frequently. Mask up. We’ve come too far to lose all of the progress we’ve made.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: COVID-19 didn’t stop being a threat because of the court ruling, because we’re tired of it, or because the legislature left town. We all have to do our part, because when it comes to fighting this virus, we are all in this together.  https://t.co/5LQwXO9UYi

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I know this is hard. I know it will be an adjustment. But we can’t let our guard down. COVID-19 is still a real threat to our families and frontline workers. The virus doesn't care if you're rich or poor, a Republican or a Democrat, young or old. Let’s all be smart and stay safe.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, after a recent surge in COVID-19 cases in the Upper Peninsula, or MERC Region 8, I signed an Executive Order that moves the region back to phase 4 of the MI Safe Start Plan. The executive order will go into effect Friday, October 9 at 12:01am.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am wishing the president and first lady a speedy recovery. COVID-19 is the most dangerous public health crisis America has faced in 100 years. It is still present in our communities. It is still spreading. And people are still dying from it every single day.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: It was great to check in with the @Hunt_Institute to discuss Michigan's support of children, families and childcare during the COVID-19 pandemic for @EarlyLearnNatn.  https://t.co/Y9750cY57A

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: It is time for the president and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to do the right thing and come to the table with congressional Democrats to negotiate a comprehensive relief package that meets the scale of the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/AnVCF4CDXM

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I announced that we are launching Futures for Frontliners, the first program in the country offering tuition-free college to the Michiganders who provided frontline services during the COVID-19 Stay Home, Stay Safe orders between April - June 2020.  https://t.co/g6Y6qynxCk

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: These Neighborhood Testing Sites are a part of the crucial work @LtGovGilchrist and the Michigan COVID-19 Task Force on Racial Disparities have done, and will make it easier for Michiganders to access testing.  Locations below 👇

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: If you’re a Michigander struggling to pay your utility bills during the COVID-19 pandemic, there is extra financial assistance available to you. Don’t wait to seek help, as the additional funding expires on Sept. 30th. Reach out today ➡️  https://t.co/i7w6t7I8U8

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Read more about the aggressive nursing home strategy that we implemented to protect older Michiganders from COVID-19 from Eric Schneidewind, former National and Michigan AARP President👇 https://t.co/JrbKkowjl2

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, we announced a $1.2M donation to Michigan’s COVID-19 Response and Recovery Initiative from @IKEAUSA, the largest donation to the fund to date. I’m extraordinarily grateful to IKEA for their generosity — this donation will be crucial to providing support and saving lives.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, the Court of Appeals ruled to uphold the emergency powers given to governors to protect Michiganders from crises. I will continue to do what I said I would from day one: taking deliberate, measured actions to protect Michiganders from COVID-19. https://t.co/Yigm57yteQ

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I will continue to use every tool at my disposal to protect Michiganders from the spread of this virus. Please, wear a mask, practice safe physical distancing, and do everything in your power to fight COVID-19.  Read more:  https://t.co/21dDcNlCgn

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I extended our Declaration of Emergency and reinstated protections for Michigan workers as we continue to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. It’s vital that employees know that they can stay home if they, or someone they’ve been in contact with, is sick.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I had a great time getting my hands dirty (or clean!) at @americanfifth making hand sanitizer for businesses and people across Michigan! I am so grateful to see business like them stepping up to help fight COVID-19.  https://t.co/Vb9sS7dYf9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Members of the National Guard have been vital to our fight against COVID-19, and our fight isn’t over yet. Today, I sent a letter to @realDonaldTrump requesting the help of the @MINationalGuard until the end of 2020. Their work will be essential to testing, distribution and more.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: By wearing masks, we can save lives and protect our family, friends, and neighbors from the spread of COVID-19. And by wearing masks now, we can put our state in a stronger position so our kids can return to school safely in the fall. Let’s #maskupmichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Wanted to take a moment to wish you a happy Fourth of July weekend. As we celebrate, please remember that, while we might get to take a break, COVID-19 does not. For the sake of the extraordinary country we love and call home, be safe, be smart, and #RecreateResponsibly.  https://t.co/Kc5rKGP20J

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: After recent COVID-19 outbreaks tied to bars, we had to take action to slow the spread & keep people safe. If we want to be in a strong position to reopen schools for this fall, we must take aggressive action now to ensure we don’t wipe out all the progress we have made.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I closed indoor service at bars throughout most of lower Michigan to protect the progress our state has made against COVID-19. I also signed bills that will allow cocktails-to-go at bars & restaurants to help these businesses serve more Michiganders.  Details ⬇️

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: If we want to set our kids up for success this fall, we must do everything in our power to mitigate the spread of COVID-19, and that means wearing a mask. Take it from one of our state’s extraordinary educators👇 #MaskUpMichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: What the upcoming school year will be like for our kids depends on each of us doing our part to flatten the COVID-19 curve. Please, continue to stay smart, stay safe, and take every recommended precaution so that our children can be safe in their classrooms this fall.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Our educators and parents have shown extraordinary leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic. While there are unknowns about the future of COVID-19 in Michigan, this plan provides the guidance, support, and clarity that is needed to safely bring students back to the classroom.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: BUDGET UPDATE: Today, the Senate Majority Leader, House Speaker, and I reached a bipartisan budget agreement that provides crucial funding for Michigan schools, families, & communities grappling with costs incurred as a result of COVID-19. Full statement:  https://t.co/Sd4dCaJNJb  https://t.co/d9l8WcxBrK

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: A new report from the Imperial College COVID-19 Response Team shows that very few states dropped their #COVID19 infection rate as low for as long as Michigan has.  This means that Michiganders who have done their part to slow the spread have, without a doubt, saved lives.  https://t.co/kX7s8wgaah

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I will be testifying before the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations about our administration’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic at 11:30AM. Tune in:  https://t.co/BQjLvHUfZH

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Michigan now has more than 250 COVID-19 testing locations. Those with mild symptoms and those who leave home for work, whether they have symptoms or not, are eligible for a test. Contact a testing site near you 👇  https://t.co/311qjOjIG3

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Extraordinarily grateful to @rihanna, her @ClaraLionelFdn, and @jack’s Start Small Fund for donating $3.2 million to help groups in Detroit and Flint on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am deeply grateful to the Michigan congressional delegation for their hard work and leadership in passing the latest federal COVID-19 relief package. Their dedication to our state is one of the many reasons we are going to get through this together.  https://t.co/UAmrTfE6qE

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, we announced the MiMortgage Relief Partnership to further ensure those experiencing financial difficulties don’t have to worry about losing their home during the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more:  https://t.co/jOSJwggj3u  https://t.co/NMLgNvM6fa

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, we announced a partnership with @CVSHealth to provide drive-through rapid #COVID19 testing in the @cityofdearborn. We need COVID-19 testing now more than ever, and I’m grateful to @RepDebDingell for her leadership in ensuring we expand testing for the virus.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: As Dr. Hurst said, the fight against COVID-19 is far from over. We will continue to make decisions based on facts and science, and will do whatever it takes to save lives. #StayHome  https://t.co/HSHGA2NY3N

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Right now, despite having the 10th largest population, we have the 3rd highest COVID-19 deaths in the nation. I’m using every tool at my disposal to save lives, and it’s working. The curve is flattening.   Remember: COVID-19 is the enemy, not each other.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am so grateful for your partnership, @NYGovCuomo. The enemy isn’t each other, it’s COVID-19. We will get through this together.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am incredibly grateful that @CAgovernor sent Michigan 50 ventilators on loan from the State of California inventory that will arrive in Lansing today. These ventilators will save lives and help our health care system treat more COVID-19 patients here in Michigan.  https://t.co/V2JceFpbzm

mentions.name: office of the governor of california

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, Hyundai Motor America announced that the city of Detroit Department of Health will receive a $100,000 grant & 10,000 test kits to help combat the spread of COVID-19. This is great news for Detroit families & health care workers. Full statement:  https://t.co/BfHZVJKMOE

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Michigan @NationalGuard members step up to support our communities in times of crisis. Learn more about how they’re doing their part during the COVID-19 pandemic ⬇️ #DoingMIPart  https://t.co/uyeJMqMBnm

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: UPDATED NUMBERS: Today, @MichiganHHS reported 1,279 new COVID-19 cases & 205 deaths. This brings our total cases to 22,783 & 1,281 deaths. Find the latest data, info & #COVID19 news at  https://t.co/m2sOFDoo30.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: NEW: Michigan’s self-employed workers, gig workers, 1099-independent contractors and low-wage workers affected by COVID-19 can apply for federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance beginning Monday, April 13 at 8AM.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Our first alternative care facility, the TCF Regional Care Center, opened today in Detroit to provide critical care to #COVIDー19 patients. We will continue to work relentlessly to ensure every COVID-19 patient can get the care they need.  https://t.co/ksC3XR1XD1

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Michigan has the third highest number of COVID-19 cases in the country, and we’re still on the upswing. We must continue to do everything we can to slow the spread and protect our families, so today, I extending the Stay Home, Stay Safe order through the end of April.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The @RedCross is seeking people who are recovered from COVID-19 to help current patients with life-threatening infections by donating plasma. If you’re fully recovered from a COVID-19 diagnosis, please click the link and fill out the Potential Donor form ⬇️ https://t.co/iQ9JWPoFFF

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I’m thinking of @KayLyme and wishing her a quick recovery. Let’s all do our part to slow the spread of COVID-19 to keep our loved ones and communities safe.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: People prioritizing the health of our communities shouldn’t be punished in the workplace. Today, I prohibited all employers from retaliating against employees for staying home from work if they or a close contact has symptoms of or has COVID-19. Read more:  https://t.co/hnuECkDVll

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The first step is contacting your health care provider to discuss your symptoms. If your health care provider decides it is necessary to test for COVID-19, they will take the sample and order testing. Visit  https://t.co/LnGYBeLlkD for more info.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I’ll be answering your COVID-19 questions tomorrow evening. Submit yours at the link below ⬇️

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: So grateful to @Ford and @UAW members for working tirelessly to ensure our health care workers have the equipment they need during the COVID-19 pandemic. This important work will help save lives.  https://t.co/kOI9uMnFLp

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We all have to be a part of the solution. Post what you’re doing to play your part in slowing the spread of COVID-19 and use the hashtag #DoingMIPart. I’m excited to see how you’re helping us get through this together!  https://t.co/1FF0Cwpe0a

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This isn’t the time to be fighting with each other. We all need to be fighting COVID-19 together.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: .@Delta’s support will help Michigan hospitals and health care providers address the influx of COVID-19 patients and help us all bend the curve and slow the spread of this virus. Thank you!   To get involved, please visit our volunteer website at  https://t.co/WZ51AQdAZw.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am thinking of Representative Carter and his family, and am hopeful for a speedy recovery. We all have to do our part to slow the spread of COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tomorrow night, I am holding a virtual town hall meeting about COVID-19 on @WOODTV with @RickAlbinWoodTV. I want to answer your questions about the current outbreak and the measures we are taking to combat it. Submit your questions below ⬇️  https://t.co/Yncbt3UWjE

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I am issuing a “Stay Home, Stay Safe” Executive Order. It goes into effect tonight at midnight.  The goal here is simple: Stay home. Stay safe. Save lives. If we all stay at home, except for critical work and needs, we can mitigate the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/JxH3HYCdsE

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Grateful that @GovHolcomb joined @GovMikeDeWine and I to call on the President & Congress to support the automotive industry and protect our auto workers in the wake of COVID-19.  https://t.co/S8Y3thKPyO

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I joined @GovMikeDewine to call on the President and Congress to support the automotive industry and protect our auto workers in the wake of COVID-19. Read more:  https://t.co/yTwOgmwMUo

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: In the coming days, I’ll be working to ensure that our seniors graduate and that no child is held back as a result of the COVID-19 school closure.    I’ve got your back. We’ll get through this together.   Full statement:  https://t.co/iJ28Llh1Lc

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: School districts and volunteers across Michigan are stepping up to provide families with meals and supplies during the COVID-19 crisis. Visit  https://t.co/8VNs83w18f for available resources and food sites in your area.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This unlocks critical financial resources for small businesses across the state impacted by the necessary steps we have taken to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Read more:  https://t.co/xpIy05TerQ

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: .@MichiganHHS has launched several statewide platforms to answer your COVID-19 questions and keep you up to date on rapidly changing information ⬇️  https://t.co/lTIgaanKY9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tonight, I signed an Executive Order to expand the capacity for child care services for health care workers, first responders, and other members of the essential workforce providing critical infrastructure to Michiganders during the COVID-19 crisis.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am grateful for the leadership of @SenGaryPeters and @SenStabenow in passing the Families First Coronavirus Response Act, which will provide vital resources & services to Michiganders as we continue to combat the spread of COVID-19.   https://t.co/bHTFuXvxsT

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I signed an Executive Order extending the deadline for Michiganders to pay back taxes & avoid foreclosure during the COVID-19 spread. This gives families immediate relief from the pressure of having their home foreclosed on while trying to focus on their health and safety.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Yesterday, I formally requested that the U.S. Small Business Administration issue an Economic Injury Disaster declaration for Michigan. Small businesses are facing unprecedented challenges due to COVID-19, & we need to ensure every possible resource is available to them.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I signed an Executive Order that enhances operational capacity and efficiency in hospitals to ensure an adequate number of health care providers are available to patients during the spread of COVID-19.  Read more:  https://t.co/1rdOIKSiJ3

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: 3/16: Lifted road weight restrictions   The latest information is available at  https://t.co/m2sOFDoo30.   For those who have questions about the state’s actions to mitigate the spread of coronavirus, please call our COVID-19 Hotline at 1-888-535-6136 between 8AM - 5PM daily.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: 3/3: Created COVID-19 task forces  3/6: Ensured Medicaid waiver for copays & cost sharing for testing 3/10: Declared a State of Emergency 3/11: Recommended mitigation strategies  3/12: Expanded access to telemedicine  3/12: Closed all K-12 schools

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tonight, I gave an update that we currently have 45 confirmed COVID-19 cases in Michigan. If you have the ability and would like to help, there is a role for you. Please call 211 to sign up to be on the central registry for volunteers to assist those most vulnerable.  https://t.co/mxmra1Rrgm

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We will continue to do everything we can to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 to protect Michiganders, and we need everyone to do their part. #COVIDー19  https://t.co/lhcVlpyUR9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This COVID-19 article has powerful visuals that explain why we all need to do our part to #FlattenTheCurve ⬇️ https://t.co/gyiMJFrNtZ

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Michiganders, if you have questions about COVID-19, please call the COVID-19 Hotline at 1-888-535-6136 between 8AM - 5PM daily.  https://t.co/awEkkMl5nr

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Our state total of COVID-19 cases is now 16. Information around this outbreak is changing rapidly. The latest information is available at  https://t.co/m2sOFDoo30 and  https://t.co/ra0iFUPne7

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The President needs to do the right thing and issue a Presidential Declaration of Emergency in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Lives are depending on it.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tonight, I announced that in order to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Michigan, I am ordering the closure of all K-12 school buildings to students starting Monday, March 16 until Sunday, April 5. School buildings are scheduled to reopen on Monday, April 6.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We also called on President Trump to allow for a special enrollment period under the ACA to allow more Americans, including Michiganders, to sign up for coverage and help mitigate the spread of COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I announced that we will expand access to telemedicine for Michiganders by immediately allowing Medicaid beneficiaries to receive services in their home while we fight the spread of COVID-19. We must do everything we can to ensure access to quality, affordable health care.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: ➡️ Learn about the signs and symptoms of COVID-19, which include fever, cough and difficulty breathing. ➡️ STAY HOME WHEN YOU ARE SICK, and those at risk of severe illness should consider staying at home to avoid others who are sick.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: [THREAD] To slow the spread of COVID-19 in Michigan, the following are some of the mitigation strategies being recommended:

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tonight, I announced that two Michigan residents tested presumptive positive for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), the first confirmed cases in our state. I have declared a state of emergency to harness our resources across state government to slow the spread of the virus.  https://t.co/zEv8pJsLNt

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: While we currently don’t have any confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Michigan, we must prepare to combat this disease from spreading. The State of Michigan is stepping up by waiving fees for testing and treatment associated with coronavirus through the Michigan Medicaid program.  https://t.co/LtGgT8howP
